text:
DIMITRI SIMAKIS: Our end goal
is to build a pyramid out

in the desert made up
entirely of steel concrete
and "Jerry Maguire" on VHS.

It's going to be
just awe inspiring.
[music playing]

We started to notice there
is a ridiculous number

of "Jerry Maguire" video
cassettes lying around.

NICK MAIER: It's
insane that this thing,

this beautiful thing was
created, loved for a second,

and then just
thrown in the trash.

DIMITRI SIMAKIS: We
decided, wouldn't it

be amazing to recreate
a '90s video store,

but only carry "Jerry
Maguire" on VHS?
[music playing]

There's something
kind of, we think,

psychedelic about
walking into this place

and just letting all the
Jerries wash over you.

It really kind of warps your
perception of waste and culture

and media and
existence as a whole.

NICK MAIER: Jonathan
Lipnicki, the Lipnicki

from "Jerry Maguire," was in
the Jerry Maguire Video Store.

And honestly, my response
was, [screeches].

DIMITRI SIMAKIS:
The next step will
be the Jerry Maguire Pyramid.

NICK MAIER: You're going to
walk through a giant door
and down a tunnel.

And then at the end
of the black tunnel,

there will be a beautiful
red glow and a giant tomb

covered in "Jerry
Maguire" VHS tapes.

And at the center will, of
course, be a giant throne
for you to sit on.

- Would you forgive
me if I didn't

believe that you were actually
going to get that done?

NICK MAIER: No, of
course you shouldn't
think that we'll get this done.
Why would we do this?
It's so stupid.

Like, at every moment, people
should be like, stop it.
Stop it.
Go.

But of course we're
going to get it done.

This is the perfect
encapsulation of our,

like, insanely stupid,
insanely awesome world.
And of course it'll happen.
